title: Global travel company will close KC office, eliminate 124 jobs
text: Travelport has occupied part of the former Trans World Airlines administrative building,… more Dave Kaup | KCBJ A travel commerce company will close its Kansas City offices as it consolidates its U.S. operations. Travelport Worldwide Ltd.'s closure would affect a total of 124 jobs, according to a Worker Adjustment and Restraining Notification (WARN) filed in Missouri on Monday. The U.K.-based company (NYSE: TVPT) operates a travel commerce platform for airlines and hotel chains, and maintains numerous offices across the globe. Travelport has occupied part of the former Trans World Airlines administrative building,… more Dave Kaup | KCBJ On Nov. 30, Travelport announced it would consolidate its three existing technology hubs in Atlanta, Denver and Kansas City into two, resulting in total cost savings of $19 million to $23 million. Its Denver and Atlanta locations will remain in place as two centers of excellence , while the Kansas City office is expected to close around the end of 2017. The move was part of a program to "enhance and optimize the company's operational and technological efficiency." According to the WARN filing, most of the layoffs will occur between April 14 and Dec. 29. "Travelport's vision is to continue redefining travel commerce, and, as such, we are constantly looking for more ways to deliver innovative technology, faster, to meet both the current and future needs of our valued customers around the world," the company said in a statement. "The customer is at the heart of these internal decisions and we believe this new strategic approach brings significant customer benefits including a higher degree of flexibility, more technical capabilities and greater speed to market of our products and services. We will update our customers when we have more information to share, meanwhile, it is very much business as usual."
